item.description: Insight Maker Illustrates the use of the Insight Maker simulation engine. No dependencies on MxGraph or ExtJS are needed to run this. Try running the Insight Maker unit tests with the runTests() command in the console. Simulated time series for the Users stock from the blank model demo:

Insight Maker Illustrates the use of the Insight Maker simulation engine to creative a simple interactive flight simulator. No dependencies on MxGraph or ExtJS are needed to run this. Simulated time series for the Users stock from the blank model demo.

Insight Maker /* CSS rules to use for styling the overlay: .chromeFrameOverlayContent .chromeFrameOverlayContent iframe .chromeFrameOverlayCloseBar .chromeFrameOverlayUnderlay */ alert("You are using an old version of Internet Explorer that does not support Insight Maker.

To run Insight Maker either:

* Update your copy of Internet Explorer to version 9 or newer.
* Use a different web browser (we recommend Google Chrome).
* Install the Chrome Frame browser plug-in for Internet Explorer (you will be prompted to do this after closing this message).

To run Insight Maker either:

* Update your copy of Internet Explorer to version 9 or newer.
* Use a different web browser (we recommend Google Chrome).

Ace (Ajax.org Cloud9 Editor) Ace is a code editor written in JavaScript. This repository has only generated files. If you want to work on ace please go to https://github.com/ajaxorg/ace instead. here you can find pre-built files for convenience of embedding. it contains 4 versions * src concatenated but not minified * src-min concatenated and minified with uglify.js * src-noconflict uses ace.require instead of require * src-min-noconflict - For a simple way of embedding ace into webpage see https://github.

Editor body { overflow: hidden; } #editor { margin: 0; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; left: 0; right: 0; } function foo(items) { var i; for (i = 0; i < items.length; i++) { alert("Ace Rocks " + items[i]); } } var editor = ace.edit("editor"); editor.setTheme("ace/theme/twilight"); editor.getSession().setMode("ace/mode/javascript");
